title: Alpha Fetoprotein Afp Test
content:
They will be able to explain the meaning of the result and discuss the available options. If the result appears to be in the ‘higher risk’ category, further tests are needed to confirm a diagnosis. For possible chromosome abnormalities, an[amniocentesis](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/a/amniocentesis "Amniocentesis")[chorionic villus(external link)(external link)](https://ranzcog.edu.au/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/Chorionic-villus-sampling-CVS.pdf "Open external link")[ultrasound scan.](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/u/ultrasound "Ultrasound")

####  More information 
The following is further reading that gives you more information on the alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) test. Be aware that websites from other countries may contain information that differs from New Zealand recommendations.  
  
[Antenatal screening for down syndrome and other conditions(external link)(external link)](https://www.nsu.govt.nz/pregnancy-newborn-screening/antenatal-screening-down-syndrome-and-other-conditions/about-test "Open external link") National Screening Unit, NZ, 2014  
[Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP)(external link)(external link)](https://pathologytestsexplained.org.au/learning/test-index/afp-tumor "Open external link")  
[Maternal screening(external link)(external link)](https://pathologytestsexplained.org.au/ptests-pro.php?q=Maternal%20screening "Open external link") Australasian Association of Clinical Biochemists
